instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.Q7010: What is Q7010? Q7010 controls whether or not PPDCIN_G3H will be let through to the PP3V42_G3H power supply, often this circuit area is not working because D7010 has died or corroded. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin.
threads.message:
Hi, got this macbook yesterday smelled burnt wipped out the board found 2 ned av7 at <CAPACITOR>C7375</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7376</CAPACITOR> burned and broken so replaced those no fan spin. checked <RESISTOR>R5450</RESISTOR> getting 0.8v instead of 8v not sure where to go from here hoping for some help.

ok just checked and thought i had a short on sys side of F7140 ..just injected 8v and got fan spin. bad fuse ? yup bad fuse even tho it showed continuity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin.
threads.message:
Do NOT do that again so fast.
If you really had a short, it could be from CPU side and fry it with 8V.
You have had luck this time.
Your problem is on the main power supply, around <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, or <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR>.
Check first 3V42 presence.
If not, post voltage for <TRANSISTOR>Q7010</TRANSISTOR> and <DIODE>D7005</DIODE>.
Next, check voltage for <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, pins 2, 3, 9, 15, 19, 20.

If you injected 8V on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> wihtout F7140, check now if no short on L7130 side.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin.
threads.message:
Thanks for the reply missed a bad fuse all working now.
I admit i was a bit fast putting power threw, but i did do it gradually.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no fan spin.
threads.message: Yeah usually when the big tantalums blow, the fuse does as well. Always best to remove the fuse to inject voltage anyways. But yeah don't inject 8 volts right away.
